mdRecord.dcterms:title: East Parlor, Mt. Vernon Mansion
mdRecord.dcterms:creator: Johnson, N. G. (Newton G.)
mdRecord.dcterms:description: Stereoscopic view of the Little Parlor including the harpsichord and relic case. Mounted on orange board. The publisher's imprint on the front of the stereograph mount reads: N. G. Johnson, Photographer, No. 317 Pa. Avenue, Washington, D. C. The Only Authorized Publisher, of Mt. Vernon Views. The label adhered on the reverse reads: East Parlor, Mt. Vernon Mansion, In which stands the case for the exhibition of interesting relics of Washington, containing a bust of Washington, supposed to be the original, by the French sculptor Houdon; his clothes, dress-sword, globe, and his Tripod with which he commenced life as a Surveyor. N. G. Johnson, Photographer, 426 7th St., Washington, D. C. Stamped in faint blue ink - Copyright 1880 by the Mount Vernon Association.
mdRecord.dcterms:subject: Mount Vernon (Va. : Estate)
